title: Working With Google Trends
summary:
Key ideas 
- Google Trends can be a useful tool for researching broader trends, but it has limitations.
- Using individual keywords may not give you an accurate analysis of the broader trend.
- Averaging large numbers of related keywords may help, but it can also cause issues.
- Factor analysis can help in generating new theories and intuitions.
- The sawtooth pattern in search queries may help determine student queries.

Key learnings 
- Averaging large numbers of related keywords would help eliminate noise and spikes in single keywords analysis. 
- Factor analysis can provide a more comprehensive view of how different keywords correspond to each other. 
- Search data of individual keywords may not offer an accurate perception of the broader trend.

Key questions 
- Can factor analysis help eliminate temporal autocorrelation when analyzing multiple search queries?
- Do search terms with the sawtooth pattern and troughs during school vacation reflect student searches?
- How can a general decline in intellectual interest in the internet affect keyword search results?
